Keywords: ALL STATIONS STOP SENDING CPDLC REQUESTS UNTIL ADVISED
ALL STATIONS RESUME NORMAL CPDLC OPERATIONS

Phraseology: “FOR IDENTIFICATION TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) HEADING (three digits).”

Example: “NOT IDENTIFIED DUE RADAR CLUTTER, RESUME OWN NAVIGATION.”
Keywords: NOT IDENTIFIED RESUME CONTINUE OWN NAVIGATION

Phraseology: “PRIMARY RADAR OUT OF SERVICE (information as necessary).”
“FLY HEADING (three digits), WHEN ABLE PROCEED DIRECT (name).”
Example: “FLY HEADING 290, WHEN ABLE PROCEED DIRECT DEBRECEN.”
Keywords: FLY HEADING WHEN ABLE PROCEED DIRECT

Phraseology: “RESUME OWN NAVIGATION [DIRECT] (significant point) [MAGNETIC TRACK (three digits) DISTANCE (number) KILOMETRES (or MILES)].”
Example: “RESUME OWN NAVIGATION DIRECT PUSTA TRACK 140 20 MILES.”
Keywords: RESUME OWN NAVIGATION DIRECT MAGNETIC TRACK DISTANCE KILOMETRES MILES
Slots: significant point, three digits, number, or MILES

Circumstance: All turns rate one or specified
Phraseology: “MAKE ALL TURNS RATE ONE (or RATE HALF, or (number) DEGREES PER SECOND) START AND STOP ALL TURNS ON THE COMMAND ‘NOW’.”
Keywords: MAKE ALL TURNS RATE ONE HALF DEGREES PER SECOND START STOP COMMAND NOW

Phraseology: “MAINTAIN (number) KILOMETRES PER HOUR (or KNOTS) [OR GREATER/LESS] [UNTIL (significant point)].”
Keywords: MAINTAIN KILOMETRES PER HOUR KNOTS GREATER LESS UNTIL

Phraseology: “DO NOT EXCEED (number) KILOMETRES PER HOUR (or KNOTS).”
Keywords: NOT EXCEED KILOMETRES PER HOUR KNOTS

Phraseology: “INCREASE (or REDUCE) SPEED TO (number) KILOMETRES PER HOUR (or KNOTS) [OR GREATER/LESS].”
Keywords: INCREASE REDUCE SPEED KILOMETRES PER HOUR KNOTS GREATER LESS

Phraseology: “INCREASE (or REDUCE) SPEED BY (number) KILOMETRES PER HOUR (or KNOTS).”
Keywords: INCREASE REDUCE SPEED KILOMETRES PER HOUR KNOTS

Circumstance: Reports required only at certain points

Phraseology: “TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) IMMEDIATELY HEADING (three digits) TO AVOID [UNIDENTIFIED] TRAFFIC (bearing and distance).”
Example: “TURN RIGHT IMMEDIATELY HEADING 240 TO AVOID TRAFFIC 2 O’CLOCK 3 MILES.”
Keywords: TURN LEFT RIGHT IMMEDIATELY HEADING AVOID UNIDENTIFIED TRAFFIC
Slots: or RIGHT, three digits, bearing and distance

Phraseology: “TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) (number) DEGREES IMMEDIATELY TO AVOID [UNIDENTIFIED] TRAFFIC (bearing and distance).”
Keywords: TURN LEFT RIGHT DEGREES IMMEDIATELY AVOID UNIDENTIFIED TRAFFIC
Slots: or RIGHT, number, bearing and distance

Phraseology: “IF NO TRANSMISSIONS RECEIVED FOR (number) MINUTES (or SECONDS) (instructions).”
“IF YOU READ (manoeuvre or SQUAWK (code or IDENT)).”

Example: “SQUAWK IDENT OBSERVED. POSITION 15 MILES NORTH. CONTINUE ON COURSE.”
Slots: manoeuvre, SQUAWK or IDENT, position, instructions

Phraseology: “VECTORING FOR VISUAL APPROACH RUNWAY (number); REPORT FIELD (or RUNWAY) IN SIGHT.”
Example: “VECTORING FOR VISUAL APPROACH RUNWAY 13; REPORT FIELD IN SIGHT.”
Keywords: VECTORING VISUAL APPROACH RUNWAY REPORT FIELD SIGHT

Example: “ILS APPROACH NOT AVAILABLE DUE MAINTENANCE, EXPECT VISUAL APPROACH.”

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
Phraseology: “YOU WILL INTERCEPT (radio aid or track) (distance) FROM (significant point or TOUCHDOWN).”
Example: “YOU WILL INTERCEPT LOCALIZER 7 MILES FROM TOUCHDOWN.”
Slots: radio aid or track, distance, significant point or TOUCHDOWN

Phraseology: “REPORT ESTABLISHED ON [ILS] LOCALIZER (or ON GBAS/SBAS/MLS APPROACH COURSE).”
Keywords: REPORT ESTABLISHED ILS LOCALIZER GBAS SBAS MLS APPROACH COURSE

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
Keywords: CLOSING FROM LEFT RIGHT REPORT ESTABLISHED

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
Phraseology: “TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) HEADING (three digits) [TO INTERCEPT] or [REPORT ESTABLISHED].”
Keywords: TURN LEFT RIGHT HEADING INTERCEPT REPORT ESTABLISHED

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
Phraseology: “EXPECT VECTOR ACROSS (localizer course or radio aid) (reason).”
Slots: localizer course or radio aid, reason

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
Phraseology: “THIS TURN WILL TAKE YOU THROUGH (localizer course or radio aid) [reason].”
Keywords: THIS TURN WILL TAKE YOU THROUGH

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
Phraseology: “TAKING YOU THROUGH (localizer course or radio aid) [reason].”

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids

Phraseology: “YOU HAVE CROSSED THE LOCALIZER (or GBAS/SBAS/MLS FINAL APPROACH COURSE). TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) IMMEDIATELY AND RETURN TO THE LOCALIZER (or COURSE).”
Example: “YOU HAVE CROSSED LOCALIZER, TURN RIGHT IMMEDIATELY AND RETURN.”
Keywords: YOU HAVE CROSSED LOCALIZER GBAS SBAS MLS FINAL APPROACH COURSE TURN LEFT RIGHT IMMEDIATELY RETURN
Slots: or GBAS/SBAS/MLS FINAL APPROACH COURSE, or RIGHT, or COURSE

Phraseology: “ILS (or MLS) RUNWAY (number) LEFT (or RIGHT) LOCALIZER (or MLS) FREQUENCY IS (frequency).”
Keywords: ILS MLS RUNWAY LEFT RIGHT LOCALIZER FREQUENCY
Slots: or MLS, number, or RIGHT, frequency

Circumstance: Avoid traffic deviating from adjacent approach
Phraseology: “TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) (number) DEGREES (or HEADING) (three digits) IMMEDIATELY TO AVOID TRAFFIC [DEVIATING FROM ADJACENT APPROACH]. CLIMB TO (altitude).”
Example: “TURN RIGHT 20 DEGREES IMMEDIATELY TO AVOID TRAFFIC, CLIMB TO 3000 FEET.”
Keywords: TURN LEFT RIGHT DEGREES HEADING IMMEDIATELY AVOID TRAFFIC DEVIATING FROM ADJACENT APPROACH CLIMB
Slots: or RIGHT, number, or HEADING, three digits, altitude

Phraseology: “CLIMB TO (altitude) IMMEDIATELY TO AVOID TRAFFIC [DEVIATING FROM ADJACENT APPROACH] (further instructions).”
Keywords: CLIMB IMMEDIATELY AVOID TRAFFIC DEVIATING FROM ADJACENT APPROACH

Phraseology: “APPROACH INSTRUCTIONS WILL BE TERMINATED AT (distance) FROM TOUCHDOWN.”
Example: “APPROACH INSTRUCTIONS WILL BE TERMINATED AT 1.5 MILES FROM TOUCHDOWN.”
Keywords: APPROACH INSTRUCTIONS WILL TERMINATED FROM TOUCHDOWN

Phraseology: “(distance) FROM TOUCHDOWN ALTITUDE (or HEIGHT) SHOULD BE (numbers and units).”
Example: “2 MILES FROM TOUCHDOWN ALTITUDE SHOULD BE 700 FEET.”
Slots: distance, or HEIGHT, numbers and units

Example: “PRECISION APPROACH NOT AVAILABLE DUE MAINTENANCE, EXPECT VISUAL APPROACH.”
“IN CASE OF GO AROUND CLIMB STRAIGHT AHEAD TO 2000 FEET.”

Keywords: REPLY NOT RECEIVED WILL CONTINUE INSTRUCTIONS

Phraseology: “SLIGHTLY (or WELL, or GOING) LEFT (or RIGHT) OF TRACK.”
Keywords: SLIGHTLY WELL GOING LEFT RIGHT TRACK
Slots: or WELL, or GOING, or RIGHT

Phraseology: “COMMENCE DESCENT NOW [AT (number) METRES PER SECOND OR (number) FEET PER MINUTE (or ESTABLISH A (number) DEGREE GLIDE PATH)].”
Example: “COMMENCE DESCENT NOW AT 700 FEET PER MINUTE.”
Keywords: COMMENCE DESCENT NOW METRES PER SECOND FEET MINUTE ESTABLISH DEGREE GLIDE PATH

Phraseology: “SLIGHTLY (or WELL, or GOING) ABOVE (or BELOW) GLIDE PATH.”
Keywords: SLIGHTLY WELL GOING ABOVE BELOW GLIDE PATH
Slots: or WELL, or GOING, or BELOW

Phraseology: “[STILL] (number) METRES (or FEET) TOO HIGH (or TOO LOW).”
Keywords: STILL METRES FEET TOO HIGH LOW
Slots: number, or FEET, or TOO LOW

Phraseology: “COMING BACK [SLOWLY (or QUICKLY)] TO THE GLIDE PATH.”
Keywords: COMING BACK SLOWLY QUICKLY GLIDE PATH

Phraseology: “ELEVATION ELEMENT UNSERVICEABLE (to be followed by appropriate instructions).”
Slots: to be followed by appropriate instructions

Phraseology: “(distance) FROM TOUCHDOWN. ALTITUDE (or HEIGHT) SHOULD BE (numbers and units).”
Example: “1.5 MILES FROM TOUCHDOWN, ALTITUDE SHOULD BE 500 FEET.”
Slots: distance, or HEIGHT, numbers and units

Example: “GO AROUND IMMEDIATELY DUE VEHICLE ON RUNWAY.”
“IF GOING AROUND CLIMB STRAIGHT AHEAD TO 2000 FEET.”

Slots: as shown in the flight plan

Phraseology: “DISCONNECTING, STAND BY FOR VISUAL AT YOUR LEFT (or RIGHT).”
Keywords: DISCONNECTING STAND VISUAL YOUR LEFT RIGHT

Section: 12.7.2.1 Prior to De-/Anti-Icing (Ground Crew ↔ Flight Crew)
Circumstance: Pilot confirms brakes and requests treatment
Phraseology: “[AFFIRM] BRAKES SET, REQUEST (type of de/anti-icing treatment and areas to be treated).”
Example: “AFFIRM BRAKES SET, REQUEST TYPE II ON WINGS AND TAIL.”
Slots: type of de/anti-icing treatment and areas to be treated

Section: 12.7.2.1 Prior to De-/Anti-Icing (Ground Crew ↔ Flight Crew)
12.7.2.1 Prior to De-/Anti-Icing (Ground Crew ↔ Flight Crew)
12.7.2.1 Prior to De-/Anti-Icing (Ground Crew ↔ Flight Crew)

Phraseology: “TYPE OF FLUID (Type I or II or III or IV).”
Slots: Type I or II or III or IV

Phraseology: “EMERGENCY IN DE-ICING BAY (number) [SHUT DOWN ENGINES or STANDBY FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS].”
Example: “EMERGENCY IN DE-ICING BAY 2 SHUT DOWN ENGINES.”
Keywords: EMERGENCY ICING BAY SHUT DOWN ENGINES STANDBY FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS

Phraseology: “The communications procedures shall be in accordance with Annex 10 Vol II — Aeronautical Telecommunications.”

Circumstance: Readback of clearances and safety-related information
Phraseology: Requirements in Chapter 4 § 4.5.7.5 apply for readbacks.
Use plain language that is clear and concise to ICAO proficiency level.
“Examples are found in the Manual of Radiotelephony (Doc 9432).”

Circumstance: Reference to types of air traffic service
Phraseology: Phraseologies are grouped by ATS type but users must know others as necessary; use with call signs.
Phrases in § 12.3 used by pilots, ATS and ground personnel.

Circumstance: Pilot operating non-RVSM-approved aircraft within RVSM airspace — initial call

Phraseology: Use same phrases as for aircraft except replace “TAXI” with “PROCEED”.
Annex 10 Vol II procedure words not repeated here.
Parentheses = mandatory insertion; square brackets = optional.

Circumstance: Assigning flight level by altimeter setting

Phraseology: “RUNWAY (or TAXIWAY) (number) WET [or STANDING WATER, or SNOW REMOVED, or TREATED, or COVERED WITH PATCHES OF (surface type)].”
Example: “RUNWAY 31 COVERED WITH PATCHES OF COMPACTED SNOW.”
Keywords: RUNWAY TAXIWAY WET STANDING WATER SNOW REMOVED TREATED COVERED PATCHES

Section: 12.3.1.12 Operational Status of Visual and Non-visual Aids
Phraseology: “(visual or non-visual aid) RUNWAY (number) (description of deficiency).”
Slots: visual or non-visual aid, number, description of deficiency

Circumstance: Report GNSS unreliability or unavailability area
Phraseology: “GNSS REPORTED UNRELIABLE (or MAY NOT BE AVAILABLE) [IN THE VICINITY OF (location)/(area)] [BETWEEN (levels)].”
Example: “GNSS MAY NOT BE AVAILABLE IN THE VICINITY OF PRAGUE BETWEEN FL 300–400.”
Keywords: GNSS REPORTED UNRELIABLE MAY NOT AVAILABLE VICINITY BETWEEN
Slots: or MAY NOT BE AVAILABLE, location, area, levels

Circumstance: Maintain vertical separation from another aircraft
Phraseology: “MAINTAIN AT LEAST (number) METRES (or FEET) ABOVE (or BELOW) (aircraft call sign).”
Keywords: MAINTAIN LEAST METRES FEET ABOVE BELOW
Slots: number, or FEET, or BELOW, aircraft call sign

Circumstance: Maintain vertical separation from another aircraft
Phraseology: “MAINTAIN AT LEAST (number) METRES (or FEET) ABOVE (or BELOW) (aircraft call sign).”
Keywords: MAINTAIN LEAST METRES FEET ABOVE BELOW
Slots: number, or FEET, or BELOW, aircraft call sign

Circumstance: Instruct aircraft to change call sign
Phraseology: “CHANGE YOUR CALL SIGN TO (new call sign) [UNTIL FURTHER ADVISED].”
Example: “CHANGE YOUR CALL SIGN TO SPEEDBIRD 123 UNTIL FURTHER ADVISED.”
Keywords: CHANGE YOUR CALL SIGN UNTIL FURTHER ADVISED

Example: “TRAFFIC TWO O’CLOCK, THREE MILES, SAME LEVEL.”

Section: 12.3.2.2 Indication of Route and Clearance Limit

Circumstance: Cross point at or above/below level
Slots: point, or ABOVE, or BELOW, level

Section: 12.3.2.6 If Clearance Cannot Be Issued Immediately
Circumstance: Clearance cannot be issued at once

Section: 12.3.2.7 When Clearance for Deviation Cannot Be Issued
Phraseology: “UNABLE, TRAFFIC (direction) BOUND (type) (level) ESTIMATED (or OVER) (point) AT (time) CALL SIGN (call sign) ADVISE INTENTIONS.”
Example: “UNABLE, TRAFFIC NORTHBOUND B737 FL310 OVER PUSTA AT 1220 CALL SIGN WZZ431 ADVISE INTENTIONS.”
Keywords: UNABLE TRAFFIC BOUND ESTIMATED OVER CALL SIGN ADVISE INTENTIONS
Slots: direction, type, level, or OVER, point, time, call sign

Section: 12.3.2.9 Instructions Associated with Flying an Offset Track
Phraseology: “ADVISE IF ABLE TO PROCEED PARALLEL OFFSET.”
“[AFTER DEPARTURE] TURN RIGHT (or LEFT) HEADING (three digits) (or CONTINUE RUNWAY HEADING) (or TRACK EXTENDED CENTRE LINE) TO (level or point).”
Example: “AFTER DEPARTURE TURN LEFT HEADING 270 TO FL 80.”
Keywords: AFTER DEPARTURE TURN RIGHT LEFT HEADING CONTINUE RUNWAY TRACK EXTENDED CENTRE LINE
Slots: or LEFT, three digits, or CONTINUE RUNWAY HEADING, or TRACK EXTENDED CENTRE LINE, level or point

Circumstance: Clearance to hold on VOR radial at DME fix
Phraseology: “CLEARED TO THE (three digits) RADIAL OF THE (name) VOR AT (distance) DME FIX [MAINTAIN/CLIMB/DESCEND TO (level)] HOLD (direction) [RIGHT/LEFT HAND PATTERN] [OUTBOUND TIME (minutes)] EXPECT APPROACH CLEARANCE AT (time).”
Example: “CLEARED TO THE 270 RADIAL OF WIEN VOR AT 10 DME HOLD EAST EXPECT APPROACH CLEARANCE AT 1230.”
Keywords: CLEARED RADIAL VOR DME FIX MAINTAIN CLIMB DESCEND HOLD RIGHT LEFT HAND PATTERN OUTBOUND TIME EXPECT APPROACH CLEARANCE
Slots: three digits, name, distance, level, direction, minutes, time

Example: “UNABLE TO ISSUE BUDAPEST ONE ALPHA DEPARTURE DUE TRAFFIC.”

Keywords: RUNWAY CLEARED TAKE OFF REPORT AIRBORNE

Section: 12.3.4.12 Turn or Climb Instructions After Take-off

Example: “REQUEST TOW WIZZ AIR A320 FROM STAND 1 TO MAINTENANCE HANGAR.”
“A320 HEAVY STAND 3 REQUEST TAXI FOR DEPARTURE.”

Keywords: ESTIMATE SQUAWKING SSR ESTIMATED DESCENDING FROM SPEED TAS REMARKS
Slots: direction, call sign, SSR, type, point, time, level, TAS, route

Phraseology: “MAY WE CHANGE CLEARANCE OF (call sign) TO (details).”
“APPROVAL REQUEST (call sign) ESTIMATED DEPARTURE FROM (point) AT (time).”

Circumstance: “INBOUND RELEASE (call sign) [SQUAWKING (SSR)] (type) FROM (point) RELEASED AT (point/time/level) CLEARED TO (limit) ESTIMATING (limit) (time) AT (level) [EXPECTED APPROACH TIME or NO DELAY EXPECTED] CONTACT AT (time).”

Phraseology: “EXPEDITE CLEARANCE (call sign) EXPECTED DEPARTURE FROM (place) AT (time).”

Example: “[ALL STATIONS] CPDLC FAILURE LOG OFF AND USE VOICE.”

Phraseology: “DISREGARD CPDLC (message type) MESSAGE, BREAK (correct clearance, instruction, information or request).”
Example: “DISREGARD CPDLC CLEARANCE MESSAGE, BREAK CLIMB TO FL350.”
Slots: message type, correct clearance, instruction, information or request

Phraseology: “SECONDARY RADAR OUT OF SERVICE (information as necessary).”
“POSITION (distance) (direction) OF (significant point) (or OVER or ABEAM (significant point)).”
Slots: distance, direction, significant point, or OVER or ABEAM (significant point

Phraseology: “MAKE A THREE SIXTY TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) [reason].”
Example: “MAKE A THREE SIXTY TURN LEFT DUE TRAFFIC.”
Keywords: MAKE THREE SIXTY TURN LEFT RIGHT

Example: “TRAFFIC TWO O’CLOCK FIVE MILES OPPOSITE DIRECTION.”

Phraseology: “VECTORING FOR (type of pilot-interpreted aid) APPROACH RUNWAY (number).”

Section: 12.4.2.2 Vectoring for ILS and Other Pilot-Interpreted Aids
Phraseology: “POSITION (number) KILOMETRES (or MILES) FROM (fix). TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) HEADING (three digits).”
Example: “POSITION 8 MILES FROM PEST. TURN LEFT HEADING 270.”
Keywords: POSITION KILOMETRES MILES FROM TURN LEFT RIGHT HEADING
Slots: number, or MILES, fix, or RIGHT, three digits

Phraseology: “CLEARED FOR (type of approach) APPROACH RUNWAY (number) LEFT (or RIGHT).”
Slots: type of approach, number, or RIGHT

Phraseology: “THIS WILL BE A SURVEILLANCE RADAR APPROACH RUNWAY (number) TERMINATING AT (distance) FROM TOUCHDOWN, OBSTACLE CLEARANCE ALTITUDE (or HEIGHT) (number) (units). CHECK YOUR MINIMA [IN CASE OF GO AROUND (instructions)].”
Example: “THIS WILL BE A SURVEILLANCE RADAR APPROACH RUNWAY 31 TERMINATING AT 2 MILES FROM TOUCHDOWN, OBSTACLE CLEARANCE ALTITUDE 600 FEET. CHECK YOUR MINIMA.”
Keywords: THIS WILL SURVEILLANCE RADAR APPROACH RUNWAY TERMINATING FROM TOUCHDOWN OBSTACLE CLEARANCE ALTITUDE HEIGHT CHECK YOUR MINIMA CASE AROUND
Slots: number, distance, or HEIGHT, units, instructions

Phraseology: “COMMENCE DESCENT NOW [TO MAINTAIN A (number) DEGREE GLIDE PATH].”
Example: “COMMENCE DESCENT NOW TO MAINTAIN 3 DEGREE GLIDE PATH.”
Keywords: COMMENCE DESCENT NOW MAINTAIN DEGREE GLIDE PATH

Phraseology: “THIS WILL BE A PRECISION RADAR APPROACH RUNWAY (number).”
Example: “THIS WILL BE A PRECISION RADAR APPROACH RUNWAY 13.”
Keywords: THIS WILL PRECISION RADAR APPROACH RUNWAY
CLOSING SLOWLY QUICKLY FROM LEFT RIGHT

Phraseology: “CONTINUE VISUALLY OR GO AROUND [missed approach instructions].”
Example: “CONTINUE VISUALLY OR GO AROUND CLIMB STRAIGHT AHEAD.”

Phraseology: “ADS-C (or ADS-CONTRACT) OUT OF SERVICE (appropriate information as necessary).”
Slots: or ADS-CONTRACT, appropriate information as necessary

Phraseology: “(call sign) LOW ALTITUDE WARNING, CHECK YOUR ALTITUDE IMMEDIATELY, QNH IS (number) [(units)]. [THE MINIMUM FLIGHT ALTITUDE IS (altitude)].”
Example: “WZZ431 LOW ALTITUDE WARNING, CHECK YOUR ALTITUDE IMMEDIATELY, QNH 1012.”
Keywords: LOW ALTITUDE WARNING CHECK YOUR IMMEDIATELY QNH MINIMUM FLIGHT

Section: 12.7.2.1 Prior to De-/Anti-Icing (Ground Crew ↔ Flight Crew)
Circumstance: Ground crew ready to begin de-icing
Phraseology: “STANDING BY TO DE-ICE. CONFIRM BRAKES SET AND TREATMENT REQUIRED.”
Keywords: STANDING ICE CONFIRM BRAKES SET TREATMENT REQUIRED

Phraseology: “DE-ICING ON (areas treated) COMPLETE. ADVISE WHEN READY FOR INFORMATION.”
Keywords: ICING COMPLETE ADVISE WHEN READY INFORMATION

Phraseology: “BE ADVISED NOZZLE PROXIMITY ACTIVATION ON (significant point on aircraft) [NO VISUAL DAMAGE or DAMAGE (description) OBSERVED] [SAY INTENTIONS].”
Example: “BE ADVISED NOZZLE PROXIMITY ACTIVATION ON LEFT WING NO VISUAL DAMAGE OBSERVED.”
Keywords: ADVISED NOZZLE PROXIMITY ACTIVATION VISUAL DAMAGE OBSERVED SAY INTENTIONS
